author: Special Correspondent
text:
Last date for submission of entries extended to March 21

Entries are open for the preliminary round of The Hindu Young World painting competition for Puducherry region.

The last date for submission of entries has been extended to March 21.

The competition, being organised in association with Thyrocare, is for two categories, juniors (Classes IV to VI) and seniors (Classes VII to IX).

The topics for juniors at the preliminary level are: ‘At the toy/pet store’, ‘Gully cricket’, ‘Sunday family picnic’, ‘Cleaning my street’, ‘A day at zoo’, ‘A day at the circus’, ‘Water birds’, ‘Scenes from a village’, ‘First visit to the public library’, and ‘Summer activities’.

For seniors, the topics are: ‘Beach clean-up’, ‘Camping out’, ‘New Year carnival’, ‘Classical/rock music concert’, ‘Book fair’, ‘Underwater life’, ‘Portraits of emotions’, ‘If dinosaurs existed today’, ‘Domesticating the wild’, ‘Retelling your favourite fairy tale’, and ‘Life without technology’.

Participants can choose any of these topics and paint on a white drawing sheet (size: 26 cm x 27 cm).

The paintings should be certified by the school principal or art teacher.

Students should mention their name, class, school, residential address, mobile number, and email ID on the reverse of the drawing sheet.

Students can send their entries to The Hindu, No 135, First Floor, Mission Street, Puducherry - 605001, Ph : 04132227111. They can also submit the entries in person at the office.

For more details, contact N. Hariharan (Mobile: 9789069672).
title: Entries open for The Hindu Young World painting contest
